climbs.name: The Yardstick aka The Red Carpet
climbs.fa: established by “Crag” Maintenance! FFA: Alex & Rich

content.description:
Climb up the middle of the black streak past difficult moves to better holds in a groove. Go up this to the roof, move slighly right for pro, then climb up left on easier moves (5.9) to the top. Use the chains of

Clear Cut

to descend.
content.protection: 4 bolts (QDs), red or gold Camalot at the roof - or do the mega runout from the last bolt like Alex.
content.location:
Start just right of the Original route (below hanging corner), and climb the black streak to the left of

Clear Cut

.

content.description: This is the leftmost of the four bolted routes. Above bolt three is a short, left-facing dihedral. Bolts four and five lie above a ledge, to the left of the dihedral. Bolt five lies just above a twelve-inch overhang. The climbing is vertical and very reachy through the crux, which is below the ledge. If Clear Cut is 10b, the Original Route is 10d, or harder, unless you are tall.
content.protection: Five bolts. A #0.3 C4, or equivalent, can be placed in a horizontal, to tame the run-out between bolts three and four. The anchor bolts, which have no chains or rings for lowering or rappelling, lie on a ledge above the finishing ledge, and are hard to see. A toprope could be set up without being on the brink of the sheer wall.
content.location: It is the leftmost of the four parallel bolted routes on the Vertical Wall.

content.description: This has edgy face climbing with fun moves. The crux is definitely the 1st 20-25 feet. There are very key gear placements, but all the gear stances are really good.
content.protection: BD C3s up to #0.75 and one #3 (currently no bolted anchor, but I will be fixing that within the month).
content.location: This the 1st climb you hit on this wall, and there is a tree to the right of this climb about halfway up the route. Start on crimps, and move left into the weakness.

content.description: Climb the orange face, making a long reach to the crack. Follow this through the upper orange face to below the roof. Climb the crack through the roof moving left and up to the top. There are chains on a block of rock up over the top
This route climbs recessed crimps, a mantle move and a few pinch-holds following bolts to the top. It is really enjoyable cruxy-climbing.
content.protection: Fully protected with 6 bolts and two bolt anchor.
content.location:
It is located 10 feet right of '

Clear Cut

.'  The top anchor is right next to a ponderosa tree. It climbs nearly the tallest part of the wall.
